member.name: T:Amazon.Transfer.Model.CreateServerRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the CreateServer operation. Instantiates an autoscaling virtual server based on Secure File Transfer Protocol (SFTP) in AWS. When you make updates to your server or when you work with users, use the service-generated ServerId property that is assigned to the newly created server.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.CreateServerRequest.EndpointDetails
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EndpointDetails.
The virtual private cloud (VPC) endpoint settings that you want to configure for your SFTP server. This parameter is required when you specify a value for the EndpointType parameter.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.CreateServerRequest.EndpointType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EndpointType.
The type of VPC endpoint that you want your SFTP server to connect to. If you connect to a VPC endpoint, your SFTP server isn't accessible over the public internet.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.CreateServerRequest.HostKey
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property HostKey.
The RSA private key as generated by the ssh-keygen -N "" -f my-new-server-key command.
If you aren't planning to migrate existing users from an existing SFTP server to a new AWS SFTP server, don't update the host key. Accidentally changing a server's host key can be disruptive.
For more information, see "https://docs.aws.amazon.com/transfer/latest/userguide/change-host-key" in the AWS SFTP User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.CreateServerRequest.IdentityProviderDetails
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IdentityProviderDetails.
This parameter is required when the IdentityProviderType is set to API_GATEWAY. Accepts an array containing all of the information required to call a customer-supplied authentication API, including the API Gateway URL. This property is not required when the IdentityProviderType is set to SERVICE_MANAGED.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.CreateServerRequest.IdentityProviderType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IdentityProviderType.
Specifies the mode of authentication for the SFTP server. The default value is SERVICE_MANAGED, which allows you to store and access SFTP user credentials within the AWS Transfer for SFTP service. Use the API_GATEWAY value to integrate with an identity provider of your choosing. The API_GATEWAY setting requires you to provide an API Gateway endpoint URL to call for authentication using the IdentityProviderDetails parameter.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.CreateServerRequest.LoggingRole
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LoggingRole.
A value that allows the service to write your SFTP users' activity to your Amazon CloudWatch logs for monitoring and auditing purposes.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.CreateServerRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
Key-value pairs that can be used to group and search for servers.

member.name: T:Amazon.Transfer.Model.CreateServerResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateServer operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.CreateServerResponse.ServerId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServerId.
The service-assigned ID of the SFTP server that is created.

member.name: T:Amazon.Transfer.Model.CreateUserRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the CreateUser operation. Creates a user and associates them with an existing Secure File Transfer Protocol (SFTP) server. You can only create and associate users with SFTP servers that have the IdentityProviderType set to SERVICE_MANAGED. Using parameters for CreateUser, you can specify the user name, set the home directory, store the user's public key, and assign the user's AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role. You can also optionally add a scope-down policy, and assign metadata with tags that can be used to group and search for users.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.CreateUserRequest.HomeDirectory
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property HomeDirectory.
The landing directory (folder) for a user when they log in to the server using their SFTP client. An example is /home/username .

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.CreateUserRequest.Policy
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Policy.
A scope-down policy for your user so you can use the same IAM role across multiple users. This policy scopes down user access to portions of their Amazon S3 bucket. Variables that you can use inside this policy include ${Transfer:UserName}, ${Transfer:HomeDirectory}, and ${Transfer:HomeBucket}.
For scope-down policies, AWS Transfer for SFTP stores the policy as a JSON blob, instead of the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the policy. You save the policy as a JSON blob and pass it in the Policy argument.
For an example of a scope-down policy, see "https://docs.aws.amazon.com/transfer/latest/userguide/users.html#users-policies-scope-down">Creating a Scope-Down Policy.
For more information, see "https://docs.aws.amazon.com/STS/latest/APIReference/API_AssumeRole.html" in the AWS Security Token Service API Reference.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.CreateUserRequest.Role
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Role.
The IAM role that controls your user's access to your Amazon S3 bucket. The policies attached to this role will determine the level of access you want to provide your users when transferring files into and out of your Amazon S3 bucket or buckets. The IAM role should also contain a trust relationship that allows the SFTP server to access your resources when servicing your SFTP user's transfer requests.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.CreateUserRequest.ServerId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServerId.
A system-assigned unique identifier for an SFTP server instance. This is the specific SFTP server that you added your user to.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.CreateUserRequest.SshPublicKeyBody
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SshPublicKeyBody.
The public portion of the Secure Shell (SSH) key used to authenticate the user to the SFTP server.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.CreateUserRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
Key-value pairs that can be used to group and search for users. Tags are metadata attached to users for any purpose.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.CreateUserRequest.UserName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UserName.
A unique string that identifies a user and is associated with a server as specified by the ServerId. This user name must be a minimum of 3 and a maximum of 32 characters long. The following are valid characters: a-z, A-Z, 0-9, underscore, and hyphen. The user name can't start with a hyphen.

member.name: T:Amazon.Transfer.Model.CreateUserResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateUser operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.CreateUserResponse.ServerId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServerId.
The ID of the SFTP server that the user is attached to.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.CreateUserResponse.UserName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UserName.
A unique string that identifies a user account associated with an SFTP server.

member.name: T:Amazon.Transfer.Model.DeleteServerRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DeleteServer operation. Deletes the Secure File Transfer Protocol (SFTP) server that you specify.
No response returns from this operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.DeleteServerRequest.ServerId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServerId.
A unique system-assigned identifier for an SFTP server instance.

member.name: T:Amazon.Transfer.Model.DeleteServerResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DeleteServer operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.Transfer.Model.DeleteSshPublicKeyRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DeleteSshPublicKey operation. Deletes a user's Secure Shell (SSH) public key.
No response is returned from this operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.DeleteSshPublicKeyRequest.ServerId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServerId.
A system-assigned unique identifier for a Secure File Transfer Protocol (SFTP) server instance that has the user assigned to it.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.DeleteSshPublicKeyRequest.SshPublicKeyId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SshPublicKeyId.
A unique identifier used to reference your user's specific SSH key.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.DeleteSshPublicKeyRequest.UserName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UserName.
A unique string that identifies a user whose public key is being deleted.

member.name: T:Amazon.Transfer.Model.DeleteSshPublicKeyResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DeleteSshPublicKey operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.Transfer.Model.DeleteUserRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DeleteUser operation. Deletes the user belonging to the server you specify.
No response returns from this operation.
When you delete a user from a server, the user's information is lost.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.DeleteUserRequest.ServerId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServerId.
A system-assigned unique identifier for an SFTP server instance that has the user assigned to it.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.DeleteUserRequest.UserName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UserName.
A unique string that identifies a user that is being deleted from the server.

member.name: T:Amazon.Transfer.Model.DeleteUserResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DeleteUser operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.Transfer.Model.DescribedServer
member.summary: Describes the properties of the server that was specified. Information returned includes the following: the server Amazon Resource Name (ARN), the authentication configuration and type, the logging role, the server ID and state, and assigned tags or metadata.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.DescribedServer.Arn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Arn.
Specifies the unique Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the server to be described.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.DescribedServer.EndpointDetails
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EndpointDetails.
The virtual private cloud (VPC) endpoint settings that you configured for your SFTP server.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.DescribedServer.EndpointType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EndpointType.
The type of endpoint that your SFTP server is connected to. If your SFTP server is connected to a VPC endpoint, your server isn't accessible over the public internet.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.DescribedServer.HostKeyFingerprint
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property HostKeyFingerprint.
This value contains the message-digest algorithm (MD5) hash of the server's host key. This value is equivalent to the output of the ssh-keygen -l -E md5 -f my-new-server-key command.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.DescribedServer.IdentityProviderDetails
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IdentityProviderDetails.
Specifies information to call a customer-supplied authentication API. This field is not populated when the IdentityProviderType of the server is SERVICE_MANAGED>.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.DescribedServer.IdentityProviderType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IdentityProviderType.
This property defines the mode of authentication method enabled for this service. A value of SERVICE_MANAGED means that you are using this server to store and access SFTP user credentials within the service. A value of API_GATEWAY indicates that you have integrated an API Gateway endpoint that will be invoked for authenticating your user into the service.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.DescribedServer.LoggingRole
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LoggingRole.
This property is an AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) entity that allows the server to turn on Amazon CloudWatch logging for Amazon S3 events. When set, user activity can be viewed in your CloudWatch logs.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.DescribedServer.ServerId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServerId.
This property is a unique system-assigned identifier for the SFTP server that you instantiate.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.DescribedServer.State
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property State.
The condition of the SFTP server for the server that was described. A value of ONLINE indicates that the server can accept jobs and transfer files. A State value of OFFLINE means that the server cannot perform file transfer operations.
The states of STARTING and STOPPING indicate that the server is in an intermediate state, either not fully able to respond, or not fully offline. The values of START_FAILED or STOP_FAILED can indicate an error condition.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.DescribedServer.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
This property contains the key-value pairs that you can use to search for and group servers that were assigned to the server that was described.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.DescribedServer.UserCount
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UserCount.
The number of users that are assigned to the SFTP server you specified with the ServerId.

member.name: T:Amazon.Transfer.Model.DescribedUser
member.summary: Returns properties of the user that you want to describe.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.DescribedUser.Arn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Arn.
This property contains the unique Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the user that was requested to be described.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.DescribedUser.HomeDirectory
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property HomeDirectory.
This property specifies the landing directory (or folder), which is the location that files are written to or read from in an Amazon S3 bucket for the described user. An example is /bucket_name/home/username .

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.DescribedUser.Policy
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Policy.
Specifies the name of the policy in use for the described user.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.DescribedUser.Role
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Role.
This property specifies the IAM role that controls your user's access to your Amazon S3 bucket. The policies attached to this role will determine the level of access you want to provide your users when transferring files into and out of your Amazon S3 bucket or buckets. The IAM role should also contain a trust relationship that allows the SFTP server to access your resources when servicing your SFTP user's transfer requests.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.DescribedUser.SshPublicKeys
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SshPublicKeys.
This property contains the public key portion of the Secure Shell (SSH) keys stored for the described user.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.DescribedUser.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
This property contains the key-value pairs for the user requested. Tag can be used to search for and group users for a variety of purposes.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.DescribedUser.UserName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UserName.
This property is the name of the user that was requested to be described. User names are used for authentication purposes. This is the string that will be used by your user when they log in to your SFTP server.

member.name: T:Amazon.Transfer.Model.DescribeServerRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DescribeServer operation. Describes the server that you specify by passing the ServerId parameter.
The response contains a description of the server's properties.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.DescribeServerRequest.ServerId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServerId.
A system-assigned unique identifier for an SFTP server.

member.name: T:Amazon.Transfer.Model.DescribeServerResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DescribeServer operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.DescribeServerResponse.Server
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Server.
An array containing the properties of the server with the ServerID you specified.

member.name: T:Amazon.Transfer.Model.DescribeUserRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DescribeUser operation. Describes the user assigned to a specific server, as identified by its ServerId property.
The response from this call returns the properties of the user associated with the ServerId value that was specified.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.DescribeUserRequest.ServerId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServerId.
A system-assigned unique identifier for an SFTP server that has this user assigned.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.DescribeUserRequest.UserName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UserName.
The name of the user assigned to one or more servers. User names are part of the sign-in credentials to use the AWS Transfer for SFTP service and perform file transfer tasks.

member.name: T:Amazon.Transfer.Model.DescribeUserResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DescribeUser operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.DescribeUserResponse.ServerId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServerId.
A system-assigned unique identifier for an SFTP server that has this user assigned.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.DescribeUserResponse.User
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property User.
An array containing the properties of the user account for the ServerID value that you specified.

member.name: T:Amazon.Transfer.Model.EndpointDetails
member.summary: The configuration settings for the virtual private cloud (VPC) endpoint for your SFTP server.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.EndpointDetails.VpcEndpointId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VpcEndpointId.
The ID of the VPC endpoint.

member.name: T:Amazon.Transfer.Model.IdentityProviderDetails
member.summary: Returns information related to the type of user authentication that is in use for a server's users. A server can have only one method of authentication.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.IdentityProviderDetails.InvocationRole
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InvocationRole.
The InvocationRole parameter provides the type of InvocationRole used to authenticate the user account.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.IdentityProviderDetails.Url
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Url.
The Url parameter provides contains the location of the service endpoint used to authenticate users.

member.name: T:Amazon.Transfer.Model.ImportSshPublicKeyRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the ImportSshPublicKey operation. Adds a Secure Shell (SSH) public key to a user account identified by a UserName value assigned to a specific server, identified by ServerId.
The response returns the UserName value, the ServerId value, and the name of the SshPublicKeyId.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.ImportSshPublicKeyRequest.ServerId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServerId.
A system-assigned unique identifier for an SFTP server.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.ImportSshPublicKeyRequest.SshPublicKeyBody
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SshPublicKeyBody.
The public key portion of an SSH key pair.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.ImportSshPublicKeyRequest.UserName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UserName.
The name of the user account that is assigned to one or more servers.

member.name: T:Amazon.Transfer.Model.ImportSshPublicKeyResponse
member.summary: This response identifies the user, the server they belong to, and the identifier of the SSH public key associated with that user. A user can have more than one key on each server that they are associated with.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.ImportSshPublicKeyResponse.ServerId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServerId.
A system-assigned unique identifier for an SFTP server.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.ImportSshPublicKeyResponse.SshPublicKeyId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SshPublicKeyId.
This identifier is the name given to a public key by the system that was imported.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.ImportSshPublicKeyResponse.UserName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UserName.
A user name assigned to the ServerID value that you specified.

member.name: T:Amazon.Transfer.Model.ListedServer

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.ListedServer.Arn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Arn.
The unique Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the server to be listed.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.ListedServer.EndpointType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EndpointType.
The type of VPC endpoint that your SFTP server is connected to. If your SFTP server is connected to a VPC endpoint, your server isn't accessible over the public internet.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.ListedServer.IdentityProviderType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IdentityProviderType.
The authentication method used to validate a user for the server that was specified. This can include Secure Shell (SSH), user name and password combinations, or your own custom authentication method. Valid values include SERVICE_MANAGED or API_GATEWAY.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.ListedServer.LoggingRole
member.summary:

The AWS Identity and Access Management entity that allows the server to turn on Amazon CloudWatch logging.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.ListedServer.ServerId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServerId.
This value is the unique system assigned identifier for the SFTP servers that were listed.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.ListedServer.State
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property State.
This property describes the condition of the SFTP server for the server that was described. A value of ONLINE> indicates that the server can accept jobs and transfer files. A State value of OFFLINE means that the server cannot perform file transfer operations.
The states of STARTING and STOPPING indicate that the server is in an intermediate state, either not fully able to respond, or not fully offline. The values of START_FAILED or STOP_FAILED can indicate an error condition.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.ListedServer.UserCount
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UserCount.
This property is a numeric value that indicates the number of users that are assigned to the SFTP server you specified with the ServerId.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.ListedUser.Arn
member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.ListedUser.HomeDirectory
member.summary:

This value specifies the location that files are written to or read from an Amazon S3 bucket for the user you specify by their ARN.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.ListedUser.Role
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Role.
The role in use by this user. A role is an AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) entity that, in this case, allows the SFTP server to act on a user's behalf. It allows the server to inherit the trust relationship that enables that user to perform file operations to their Amazon S3 bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.ListedUser.SshPublicKeyCount

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.ListedUser.UserName
member.summary:

The name of the user whose ARN was specified. User names are used for authentication purposes.

member.name: T:Amazon.Transfer.Model.StartServerRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the StartServer operation. Changes the state of a Secure File Transfer Protocol (SFTP) server from OFFLINE to ONLINE. It has no impact on an SFTP server that is already ONLINE. An ONLINE server can accept and process file transfer jobs.
The state of STARTING indicates that the server is in an intermediate state, either not fully able to respond, or not fully online. The values of START_FAILED can indicate an error condition.
No response is returned from this call.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.StartServerRequest.ServerId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServerId.
A system-assigned unique identifier for an SFTP server that you start.

member.name: T:Amazon.Transfer.Model.StartServerResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the StartServer operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.Transfer.Model.StopServerRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the StopServer operation. Changes the state of an SFTP server from ONLINE to OFFLINE. An OFFLINE server cannot accept and process file transfer jobs. Information tied to your server such as server and user properties are not affected by stopping your server. Stopping a server will not reduce or impact your Secure File Transfer Protocol (SFTP) endpoint billing.
The state of STOPPING indicates that the server is in an intermediate state, either not fully able to respond, or not fully offline. The values of STOP_FAILED can indicate an error condition.
No response is returned from this call.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.StopServerRequest.ServerId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServerId.
A system-assigned unique identifier for an SFTP server that you stopped.

member.name: T:Amazon.Transfer.Model.StopServerResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the StopServer operation.

member.summary: Creates a key-value pair for a specific resource. Tags are metadata that you can use to search for and group a resource for various purposes. You can apply tags to servers, users, and roles. A tag key can take more than one value. For example, to group servers for accounting purposes, you might create a tag called Group and assign the values Research and Accounting to that group.

member.name: T:Amazon.Transfer.Model.UpdateServerRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the UpdateServer operation. Updates the server properties after that server has been created.
The UpdateServer call returns the ServerId of the Secure File Transfer Protocol (SFTP) server you updated.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.UpdateServerRequest.EndpointDetails
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EndpointDetails.
The virtual private cloud (VPC) endpoint settings that are configured for your SFTP server. With a VPC endpoint, your SFTP server isn't accessible over the public internet.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.UpdateServerRequest.EndpointType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EndpointType.
The type of endpoint that you want your SFTP server to connect to. You can choose to connect to the public internet or a virtual private cloud (VPC) endpoint. With a VPC endpoint, your SFTP server isn't accessible over the public internet.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.UpdateServerRequest.HostKey
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property HostKey.
The RSA private key as generated by ssh-keygen -N "" -f my-new-server-key.
If you aren't planning to migrate existing users from an existing SFTP server to a new AWS SFTP server, don't update the host key. Accidentally changing a server's host key can be disruptive.
For more information, see "https://docs.aws.amazon.com/transfer/latest/userguide/configuring-servers.html#change-host-key" in the AWS SFTP User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.UpdateServerRequest.IdentityProviderDetails
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IdentityProviderDetails.
This response parameter is an array containing all of the information required to call a customer's authentication API method.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.UpdateServerRequest.LoggingRole
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LoggingRole.
A value that changes the AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that allows Amazon S3 events to be logged in Amazon CloudWatch, turning logging on or off.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.UpdateServerRequest.ServerId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServerId.
A system-assigned unique identifier for an SFTP server instance that the user account is assigned to.

member.name: T:Amazon.Transfer.Model.UpdateServerResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the UpdateServer operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.UpdateServerResponse.ServerId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServerId.
A system-assigned unique identifier for an SFTP server that the user account is assigned to.

member.name: T:Amazon.Transfer.Model.UpdateUserRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the UpdateUser operation. Assigns new properties to a user. Parameters you pass modify any or all of the following: the home directory, role, and policy for the UserName and ServerId you specify.
The response returns the ServerId and the UserName for the updated user.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.UpdateUserRequest.HomeDirectory
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property HomeDirectory.
A parameter that specifies the landing directory (folder) for a user when they log in to the server using their client. An example is /home/username .

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.UpdateUserRequest.Policy
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Policy.
Allows you to supply a scope-down policy for your user so you can use the same AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role across multiple users. The policy scopes down user access to portions of your Amazon S3 bucket. Variables you can use inside this policy include ${Transfer:UserName}, ${Transfer:HomeDirectory}, and ${Transfer:HomeBucket}.
For scope-down policies, AWS Transfer for SFTP stores the policy as a JSON blob, instead of the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the policy. You save the policy as a JSON blob and pass it in the Policy argument.
For an example of a scope-down policy, see "https://docs.aws.amazon.com/transfer/latest/userguide/users.html#users-policies-scope-down">Creating a Scope-Down Policy.
For more information, see "https://docs.aws.amazon.com/STS/latest/APIReference/API_AssumeRole.html" in the AWS Security Token Service API Reference.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.UpdateUserRequest.Role
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Role.
The IAM role that controls your user's access to your Amazon S3 bucket. The policies attached to this role will determine the level of access you want to provide your users when transferring files into and out of your Amazon S3 bucket or buckets. The IAM role should also contain a trust relationship that allows the Secure File Transfer Protocol (SFTP) server to access your resources when servicing your SFTP user's transfer requests.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.UpdateUserRequest.ServerId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServerId.
A system-assigned unique identifier for an SFTP server instance that the user account is assigned to.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.UpdateUserRequest.UserName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UserName.
A unique string that identifies a user and is associated with a server as specified by the ServerId. This is the string that will be used by your user when they log in to your SFTP server. This user name is a minimum of 3 and a maximum of 32 characters long. The following are valid characters: a-z, A-Z, 0-9, underscore, and hyphen. The user name can't start with a hyphen.

member.name: T:Amazon.Transfer.Model.UpdateUserResponse
member.summary: UpdateUserResponse returns the user name and server identifier for the request to update a user's properties.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.UpdateUserResponse.ServerId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServerId.
A system-assigned unique identifier for an SFTP server instance that the user account is assigned to.

member.name: P:Amazon.Transfer.Model.UpdateUserResponse.UserName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UserName.
The unique identifier for a user that is assigned to the SFTP server instance that was specified in the request.

member.name: T:Amazon.Transfer.AmazonTransferClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing Transfer
AWS Transfer for SFTP is a fully managed service that enables the transfer of files directly into and out of Amazon S3 using the Secure File Transfer Protocol (SFTP)also known as Secure Shell (SSH) File Transfer Protocol. AWS helps you seamlessly migrate your file transfer workflows to AWS Transfer for SFTPby integrating with existing authentication systems, and providing DNS routing with Amazon Route 53so nothing changes for your customers and partners, or their applications. With your data in S3, you can use it with AWS services for processing, analytics, machine learning, and archiving. Getting started with AWS Transfer for SFTP (AWS SFTP) is easy; there is no infrastructure to buy and set up.

member.name: M:Amazon.Transfer.AmazonTransferClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonTransferClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.Transfer.AmazonTransferClient.CreateUserAsync(Amazon.Transfer.Model.CreateUserRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Creates a user and associates them with an existing Secure File Transfer Protocol (SFTP) server. You can only create and associate users with SFTP servers that have the IdentityProviderType set to SERVICE_MANAGED. Using parameters for CreateUser, you can specify the user name, set the home directory, store the user's public key, and assign the user's AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role. You can also optionally add a scope-down policy, and assign metadata with tags that can be used to group and search for users.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CreateUser service method.

member.name: M:Amazon.Transfer.AmazonTransferClient.StartServerAsync(Amazon.Transfer.Model.StartServerRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Changes the state of a Secure File Transfer Protocol (SFTP) server from OFFLINE to ONLINE. It has no impact on an SFTP server that is already ONLINE. An ONLINE server can accept and process file transfer jobs.
The state of STARTING indicates that the server is in an intermediate state, either not fully able to respond, or not fully online. The values of START_FAILED can indicate an error condition.
No response is returned from this call.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the StartServer service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the StartServer service method, as returned by Transfer.
member.exception: This exception is thrown when an error occurs in the AWS Transfer for SFTP service.
This exception is thrown when the client submits a malformed request.
This exception is thrown when a resource is not found by the AWS Transfer for SFTP service.
The request has failed because the AWS Transfer for SFTP service is not available.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for StartServer Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.Transfer.AmazonTransferClient.StopServerAsync(Amazon.Transfer.Model.StopServerRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Changes the state of an SFTP server from ONLINE to OFFLINE. An OFFLINE server cannot accept and process file transfer jobs. Information tied to your server such as server and user properties are not affected by stopping your server. Stopping a server will not reduce or impact your Secure File Transfer Protocol (SFTP) endpoint billing.
The state of STOPPING indicates that the server is in an intermediate state, either not fully able to respond, or not fully offline. The values of STOP_FAILED can indicate an error condition.
No response is returned from this call.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the StopServer service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the StopServer service method, as returned by Transfer.
member.exception: This exception is thrown when an error occurs in the AWS Transfer for SFTP service.
This exception is thrown when the client submits a malformed request.
This exception is thrown when a resource is not found by the AWS Transfer for SFTP service.
The request has failed because the AWS Transfer for SFTP service is not available.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for StopServer Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.Transfer.IAmazonTransfer.StartServerAsync(Amazon.Transfer.Model.StartServerRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Changes the state of a Secure File Transfer Protocol (SFTP) server from OFFLINE to ONLINE. It has no impact on an SFTP server that is already ONLINE. An ONLINE server can accept and process file transfer jobs.
The state of STARTING indicates that the server is in an intermediate state, either not fully able to respond, or not fully online. The values of START_FAILED can indicate an error condition.
No response is returned from this call.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the StartServer service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.

member.name: M:Amazon.Transfer.IAmazonTransfer.StopServerAsync(Amazon.Transfer.Model.StopServerRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Changes the state of an SFTP server from ONLINE to OFFLINE. An OFFLINE server cannot accept and process file transfer jobs. Information tied to your server such as server and user properties are not affected by stopping your server. Stopping a server will not reduce or impact your Secure File Transfer Protocol (SFTP) endpoint billing.
The state of STOPPING indicates that the server is in an intermediate state, either not fully able to respond, or not fully offline. The values of STOP_FAILED can indicate an error condition.
No response is returned from this call.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the StopServer service method.
